abstract: Former Chad Pres Hissene Habre, who was ousted in 1990 and has been living in exile in Senegal, begins shouting and is removed from courtroom on first day of his trial for crimes against humanity, war crimes and torture.
lead_paragraph: Twenty-five years after he was overthrown, Hissène Habré finally went on trial on Monday in a special court in Senegal backed by the African Union.

headline.main: Ex-Leader of Chad Goes on Trial for Crimes Against Humanity
headline.print_headline: Outburst by Chad Ex-Leader Opens His War Crimes Trial

snippet: Twenty-five years after he was overthrown, Hissène Habré finally went on trial on Monday in a special court in Senegal backed by the African Union.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
